title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Financial Sales and Trading Agents

content.rendered:
What are Financial Sales and Trading Agents?

Financial sales and Trading Agents work with clients to buy and sell stocks and often provide financial advice about a wide range of topics–stocks, bonds, market conditions, and mutual funds, for example–to an individual client or organization.

Where do Financial Sales and Trading Agents work?

  • Commercial banks
  • Equity groups
  • Investment banks

How much do Financial Sales and Trading Agents make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for Financial Sales and Trading Agents is $80,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Financial Sales and Trading Agents?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Finance majors
  • Business majors
  • Economics majors
Search relevant jobs

Financial Sales and Trading Agents skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Financial Sales and Trading Agents succeed in their work:

  • Strong math skills
  • Great interpersonal skills
  • Knowledge of market trends

What are some common questions about Financial Sales and Trading Agents?

Q: What’s it like to be a Finance Sales intern?

A: Learn about finance internships here!

excerpt.rendered: Learn about the average salary, relevant studies, questions, and common path after college to becoming Financial Sales and Trading Agents.
